feature1.explanation: Both texts use hyphens and commas to separate clauses or phrases.

feature2.explanation: Both texts use informal and colloquial language, though with different tones.

feature3.explanation: Text 1 has more complex sentences with varied structures, while Text 2 has shorter and more direct sentences.

feature4.explanation: Text 2 has a more informal and sarcastic tone compared to the more factual tone of Text 1.

feature5.explanation: Both texts are free of spelling and typographical errors.

overall.explanation: Considering the differences in lexical features, sentence structures, and tone, the likelihood of the two texts being written by the same author is moderate.
